etymologies: modern Latin, named after Leonhard Rauwolf (died 1596), German botanist

definitions: a tropical shrub or small tree, some kinds of which are cultivated for the medicinal drugs that they yield.

notes.text: Genus Rauwolfia (or Rauvolfia), family Apocynaceae: many species, in particular the Indian snakeroot (R. serpentina), from which the drug reserpine is obtained

shortDefinitions: tropical shrub or small tree, some kinds
